page.title: 02THE GOLF CLUB
page.content: There is a strong tradition of GOLFING in MACCLESFIELD.The club was founded in 1889 and is in fact the second oldest club in Cheshire. The club at the HOLLINS has 11 separate greens looked after for the 250 members by 3 groundstaff who work there all year. The club is also open to nonmembers and has junior members.The club also employs a Professional player who gives lessons and advice to the other golfers there.As well as this there is a Steward who is in charge of the general organisation of the club.Alongside the usual golf tournaments there are social events for the whole family such as Barbecues in the summer and parties at Christmas.
